definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize

sentences.english: The time we spent together are like fireworks.
Birds resort unto their like: so truth will return to them that practise her.
sentences.chinese: 鳥獸與同類相聚，真理也必歸於實行真理的人。

sentences.english: Fortunately, we manage to assemble at the foot of the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 但可幸我們全部相聚于山腳下。

sentences.english: My father and I only meet at meals.
sentences.chinese: 我父親和我只在進餐時間相聚。

sentences.english: Is it? Then I agreed, and magnolia good to be together each spring.
sentences.chinese: 是嗎？那我就和玉蘭花約定好每年春天都要相聚。

sentences.english: Solid free polymer drilling fluid was used in the fourth interval.
sentences.chinese: 四開採用無固相聚合物鑽井液。

sentences.english: Tonight, it gives me great pleasure to gather with my friends, both old and new, to celebrate the New Year.
sentences.chinese: 今晚很高興與各位新老朋友相聚，共賀新年。

sentences.english: After three years together, nobody thought to invite Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 以後三年相聚，沒有人想起邀請小張。

sentences.english: It's probably the biggest collection of Chelsea old boys in one place ever.
sentences.chinese: 可能這是切爾西老男孩在同一地點相聚最齊的一次。

sentences.english: They were given a half hour to exchange greetings.
As soon as you feel stronger, we can get together and lift a few beers.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你稍爲強壯，我們就能相聚一堂，把酒歡樂。

sentences.english: And the word "us" covers the great crowd of men and women who will all meet in heaven some day.
sentences.chinese: 是指歷世歷代接受救恩，將來會在天家相聚的男女。

sentences.english: It is a great pleasure to meet with you and other colleagues from ASEM members in Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 很高興在柏林與亞歐會議成員的同事們相聚。

sentences.english: Self-service wedding for friends provides a new form.
sentences.chinese: 自助式婚慶爲朋友相聚提供了一種新形式。

sentences.english: Happy new year!Wishing that we will be soon together.
sentences.chinese: 向您致以新年的祝福，希望不久我們就能相聚。

sentences.english: I hope we'll get together again soon. Good-bye for now.
sentences.chinese: 希望不久再相聚，現在再見吧。

definition: to see each other/to meet in person
to agree (on a meeting place, date etc)/to reach agreement/to make an appointment
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to meet again after a long period of separation
(of relatives or friends) to live far apart from each other
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
